item.title: How many bitcoins are there currently in circulation?
item.description:
How many bitcoins are there currently in circulation?

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. Join them; it only takes a minute: Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top If you are running Bitcoin Core, you can see the total amount in circulation using the RPC call gettxoutsetinfo (in the Bitcoin-Qt debug console, or using bitcoin-cli if you run bitcoind).

item.title: Why Are All the High Rollers Moving Their Action to mBit Casino?
item.description:
Why Are All the High Rollers Moving Their Action to mBit Casino?

August 17, 2016, Curacao - Bitcoin and its underlying technology have been creating waves across the industries with their disruptive nature. Among all the industries, this revolutionary invention has impacted online gambling industry the most. With Bitcoin, it is now possible for the gambling platforms to offer instant withdrawal options to their users so that they can receive immediate payouts.

item.title: Stealing bitcoins with badges: How Silk Road's dirty cops got caught
item.description:
Stealing bitcoins with badges: How Silk Road's dirty cops got caught

View more stories DEA Special Agent Carl Force wanted his money-real cash, not just numbers on a screen-and he wanted it fast. It was October 2013, and Force had spent the past couple of years working on a Baltimore-based task force investigating the darknet's biggest drug site, Silk Road.

item.title: How can I create a visualization of blockchain activity?
item.description:
How can I create a visualization of blockchain activity?

I was helping a neighbor change the tire on his truck, we jacked up the front end, pulled the tire off and put the new one on. I finish putting the lugnuts on nice and tight. He then says. "Oh and I have to replace the brake pad too, do I just pop it in?"

item.title: What would you like to see in a book on the blockchain?
item.description:
What would you like to see in a book on the blockchain?

Rudest encounter I ever had was the mother of a child waiting in line to get their face painted by me. She stood near me while her child waited and several times commented to her friends that she could do a better job and that I was taking too long and lots of nasty things about me and my talent as an artist.

item.title: The Wretched, Endless Cycle of Bitcoin Hacks
item.description:
The Wretched, Endless Cycle of Bitcoin Hacks

It seemed bitcoin exchange Bitfinex was doing all the right things. In the end, that didn't stop hackers from stealing $65 million. The latest in a long list of attacks on the digital currency since its birth in 2009 has been particularly vexing for the bitcoin community.

item.title: Ether Camp Online Hackathon Attracts 500 Programmers
item.description:
Ether Camp Online Hackathon Attracts 500 Programmers

This October Also read: Blockstream & Core Developers' BIP Identity Crisis Ether Camp is holding its 2nd hackathon with over 500 programmers competing for $50,000 in Ether. The four-week contest hosted online has invoked hundreds of ideas from hackers looking to win the prize money, and the entire event will be streamed live for the public's viewing.

item.title: World Gold Coin Gets Listed on C-CEX Cryptocurrency Exchange
item.description:
World Gold Coin Gets Listed on C-CEX Cryptocurrency Exchange

August 17, 2016, Hong Kong - World Gold Coin announces its inclusion into the well-known cryptocurrency exchange, C-CEX. The listing now allows cryptocurrency users to trade the new digital currency against Bitcoin and other altcoins. Created by a well-known Hong Kong-based digital currency solutions company, World Gold Coin is already gaining prominence in South East Asia.

item.title: Bitcoin Weekly 2016 August 17: Bitfinex hack interim report, KeepKey wallet does ShapeShift trades, Copay users can purchase Amazon gift cards
item.description:
Bitcoin Weekly 2016 August 17: Bitfinex hack interim report, KeepKey wallet does ShapeShift trades, Copay users can purchase Amazon gift cards

It's the week of wallets in the Bitcoin ecosystem with KeepKey and BitPay's Copay both making announcements. The hardware wallet KeepKey just announced a firmware change that allows wallet users to make trades on the ShapeShift cryptocurrency exchange platform (currently for Bitcoin, Litecoin and Dogecoin).

item.title: Bitcoin 'targeted by state sponsored attackers' say Bitcoin devs
item.description:
Bitcoin 'targeted by state sponsored attackers' say Bitcoin devs

Bitcoin.org is warning that the Bitcoin Core, the as-close-to-official-as-it-gets version of Blockchain consolidation software and Bitcoin wallets, has likely been compromised. "Bitcoin.org has reason to suspect that the binaries for the upcoming Bitcoin Core release [version 0.13.0] will likely be targeted by state sponsored attackers," the organisation says in a post that does not elaborate which state may be be behind the threat or the nature of any attack.
